entry.title: manakai/perl-web-css
entry.summary:
CSS, Selectors, and Media Queries

=head1 NAME

Web::CSS - CSS, Selectors, and Media Queries

=head1 MODULES

LWeb::CSS::Parser, LWeb::CSS::Serializer - CSS syntax

LWeb::CSS::Values, LWeb::CSS::Colors, LWeb::CSS::Props - CSS definitions and microsyntax implementations

LWeb::CSS::Selectors::Parser, LWeb::CSS::Selectors::Serializer - Selectors syntax

LWeb::CSS::Selectors::API - Selectors API implementation

LWeb::CSS::MediaQueries::Parser, LWeb::CSS::MediaQueries::Serializer - Media Queries syntax

LWeb::CSS::MediaQueries::Features - Media Queries feature definitions

LWeb::CSS::Context, LWeb::CSS::MediaResolver - Support modules

Unless you are trying to develop a Web browser, you should not use these modules directly. The perl-web-dom package https://github.com/manakai/perl-web-dom contains an implementation of the standard CSSOM API and Selectors API using these modules.

=head1 DEPENDENCY

These modules require Perl 5.8 or later.

The C<parse_byte_string> method in the LWeb::CSS::Parser module requires the perl-web-encodings package https://github.com/manakai/perl-web-encodings.

=head1 SPECIFICATIONS

For the list of supported features and relevant specifications, see the documentation of the modules. In general, they support latest CSS, Selectors, and/or Media Queries standards.

=head1 AUTHOR

Wakaba wakaba@suikawiki.org.

=head1 LICENSE

Copyright 2007-2013 Wakaba wakaba@suikawiki.org.

This library is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the same terms as Perl itself.
